column4: i'm to do a command "sudo patch -p1 < 2.6.24.patch" and it's giving me permission denied even with sudo, why?
trying*
chmod -R +w .  Probably don't have write set
do that in the dir you are trying to patch obviously.
using sudo?  is this on an nfs mounted filesystem?
redid it with sudo, seemed to work but then i was still denied permission for the first command
i'm on a fresh install from windows vista so maybe my hdd is ntfs still...
do "cat /proc/mounts" and look for the filesystem you are doing this on.  make sure it's "rw"  though the chmod shouldn't have worked if it weren't.
yeah it says rw
and it's ext3?
yeah ext3
can you pastebin or msg me the exact text of what happens?
sure, for which command?
the patch.  you said the chmod worked correct?
yeah one sec
http://paste.ubuntu.com/42288/
do "ls -l 2.6.24.patch"  is it readable?
lol.  that file is readable by root I bet, but not the user you are before sudoing.  try "sudo chmod 644 2.6.24.patch" and try again.
yup that worked ^^
thanks man
np.  I've done the same thing before.
so it was something with my user rights?
yea.  root (who you became after the sudo) could read the file, but the "< 2.6.24.patch" part is done as your user not root.
oh gotcha
